section.title: Description
section.para: Binding does not work for all components in JSP: it is impossible to use the"binding" attribute for RichFaces components, since wrong class-name is used in TLD generated from XML configuration files.

section.title: How to reproduce
section.para: The described above problem occurs if binding attribute is used with RichFaces components.

section.title: Causes
section.para: There was a wrong <classname>java.lang.String</classname> specified instead of <classname>javax.faces.component.UIComponent</classname> in configuration files.

section.title: Workarounds
section.para: The solution is to use Facelets upgrade to RichFaces 3.2.0 SP1
